sentences.en: Chirkpar rattled past him on the right to snatch the prize by a nose.
sentences.cn: 一匹名为切厄克帕的赛马从他右侧疾驰而过，以一鼻之差获胜。

sentences.en: From long experience she knew exactly where to snatch.
sentences.cn: 根据日积月累的经验,她知道从哪里准能偷到.

sentences.en: Frost holed a bunker shot from 50 feet to snatch the title by one stroke.
sentences.cn: 弗罗斯特在50英尺外的沙坑中击球入穴，以一杆的优势获得冠军。

sentences.en: God is willing to snatch your soul from eternal damnation.
sentences.cn: 上帝是愿意把你的灵魂从永恒的地狱中打救出来的.

sentences.en: He had a snatch of sleep sitting in his chair.
sentences.cn: 他坐在椅子里稍睡片刻.

sentences.en: He snatched up the telephone.
sentences.cn: 他一把抓起了电话。

sentences.en: He would snatch eagerly at a plan.
sentences.cn: 他会热切地抓住这个计策.

sentences.en: I snatched a glance at the mirror.
sentences.cn: 我乘机瞥了一眼镜子。

sentences.en: It is rude to snatch.
sentences.cn: 攫夺是不礼貌的.

sentences.en: It's rude to snatch.
sentences.cn: 你争我夺是粗鲁的行为.

sentences.en: Mick snatched the cards from Archie's hand.
sentences.cn: 米克一把夺过阿彻手里的牌。

sentences.en: reports of a bag snatch
sentences.cn: 抢夺手提包的报道

sentences.en: She clutched her purse tightly, fearing that a thief might snatch it.
sentences.cn: 她紧紧抓着自己的钱包, 生怕小偷把包抢去.

sentences.en: She managed to snatch the gun from his hand.
sentences.cn: 她设法从他手里夺过了枪。

sentences.en: The owner made a dive for the rejected clothing and began to snatch it this way and that.
sentences.cn: 店主冲向那堆挑剩的衣服,开始翻来翻去.

sentences.en: The player made a snatch at the ball and caught it.
sentences.cn: 那个运动员去抢球,抢到了手.

sentences.en: The thief made a snatch at the woman's purse.
sentences.cn: 小偷试图抢夺那妇女的钱包.

sentences.en: The thief snatched her purse and ran.
sentences.cn: 小偷抢了她的钱包就跑。

sentences.en: We snatch at every chance to improve our work.
sentences.cn: 我们抓住一切机会改进我们的工作.

sentences.en: You can even snatch a few hours off, and perhaps negotiate the occasional night off too.
sentences.cn: 你甚至可以抽空休息几小时，商量一下的话没准还能偶尔不用上晚班。

sentences.en: 英文例句:The thief snatched her purse and ran.
sentences.cn: 小偷抢了她的钱包就跑。

trans.tran_cn: 抢，一阵子，一下工夫，很小的数量，<美俚>诱拐
trans.tran_en: a short part of a conversation, song etc that you hear
to take something away from someone with a quick, often violent, movement

trans.tran_cn: 作出握住或抢夺的动作，很快接受
trans.tran_en: If you snatch an opportunity, you take it quickly. If you snatch something to eat or a rest, you have it quickly in between doing other things.

trans.tran_cn: 抢夺，夺得，及时救助，[体育运动]举重
trans.tran_en: to take something away from someone with a quick, often violent, movement
If you snatch something or snatch at something, you take it or pull it away quickly
